captions.text: I can teach you all the things I've learned these past 20 years like...
Or if you press his elbow like this...
it will turn him into his "Alpha" mode.
And do this, and he has the ability to speak!
Whoa!  Mom!  How do you know all of this?
I've been a really bad mother.
I've waited a long time for this!
You can not take our dragons!
They are controlled by the alpha!
Then it's a good thing I brought a challenger.
Awgh.. I wanted to change his mind about dragons...
He was gonna kill my wife! ...
And I was carrying my axe...
plus I'm a viking so... you know.
*sigh*  yeah OK.  I guess that's true
Let's all go home.  One Big Happy Family!
Hey.  I've been thinking a lot lately... uh...
How come all the adults in our village have really strong accents...

comments.author: dshotkin

comments.text:
I think Hiccup, despite not wanting to following in his father's footsteps, 
managed to learn from his mistake (the ideal that all people could be 
reasoned with, thus resulting in great tragedy) because Stoic told him 
earlier that they have to protect their own. Hiccup is offended by, what 
seems to him, this narrow minded view. After losing his father and almost 
losing everything else in the wake of a man who just "wants to see the 
world burn" (see Dark Knight), Hiccup repeats this saying at the end of the 
movie when he becomes chief. As someone famous once said, "I believe some 
people could be improved by death".﻿

comments.author: WorldWalker128

comments.text:
True this ending would've be all nice and dandy. However I think the way 
the movie went on was alot better, considering it was a bit more reasonable 
with the events considering the mindsets of the characters, not everyone 
can make the best of decisions and not everything goes according to plan, 
in a situation like this a single mistake can mean catastrophe, however 
even knowing this people like to stick to what they want to do and what 
they believe is right. I personally would've gone for the kill, but at the 
same time I don't have the mindset of Hiccup, who's alot more passionate 
and kind about things, if I were in this situation there probably wouldn't 
have been a damn movie, I can say that probably that goes for all of us, we 
either would've just left Toothless after shooting him down, or straight up 
tried to stab him and either succeed or get eaten and blown up. People can 
say "Oh I would've done this or this." but in the end it doesn't really 
matter due to the way we think being completely different compared to 
someone IN that situation. I kinda went on a rant here and strayed off 
topic a few times but oh well, words are words, my brain sucks and staying 
on topic, yadda yadda yadda.﻿

Awesome video! I would have How to Train Your Dragon 2 end with Heather 
coming back and saving everyone. From what we know, she left in the series 
to another country with all of this knowledge in training dragons - and 
Hiccup never saw her again. :( Yeah, it wouldn't be as funny as this, but I 
would love for her to return. Maybe she'll be back in How to Train Your 
Dragon 3 (coming for 2018)?

Edit: While I'm at it, you guys should totally do a "How Big Hero 6 should 
have ended". That would be pure awesome, especially if Tadashi gets saved!﻿
